title: AVP, Actuarial Models - Governance
content:
Summary
The AVP, Actuarial Models is responsible for overseeing and directing the Actuarial Model Governance team, primarily for the Moody’s AXIS actuarial modeling software. Responsibilities include acting as model governor and chair of the Actuarial Model Governance Committee. 
This position reports to the VP, Actuarial Models and will interact with multiple levels of senior management, including significant ongoing exposure with VPs of Actuarial, Finance, IT and Risk, as well as SVPs of Finance, Financial Planning & Analysis (FP&A), Retail and Institutional Business Units, and the Chief Actuary and Chief Risk Officer. This is a leadership position and will manage a team of 4-6 team members, including responsibility for their selection, training and development in conjunction with the Chief Actuary and Human Resources’ overall training and staff development plan for all actuaries.
Duties and Responsibilities

Organizing and chairing the Actuarial Model Governance Committee
Disciplined execution of model governance protocols is essential to ensure timeliness and accuracy of actuarial model output
Enforce change management procedures and testing while also looking for process efficiency
Creation and management of collaborative tools for managing change requests, testing, review and planning
Maintain clear centralized model documentation covering things such as model methodologies and assumptions sets associated with each model release
Creation and management of AXIS Enterprise Link work areas and user permissions to ensure software development lifecycle best practices
Monitor cloud computing environment and collaborate closely with IT and Moody’s as changes are needed
Collaborate with F&G’s internal Controls and Risk teams, as well as Internal Audit, our external auditors, and various state insurance department requests
Accurate and timely execution of job functions are essential for this position as key management decisions and external reporting are based on the results of actuarial models 
Driving for process improvements and efficiencies.

 
Experience and Education Requirements

Bachelors Degree in Actuarial Science, Math, Finance, Statistics or other related area
Minimum ASA; FSA preferred
Seven to ten years of experience with actuarial models required
Experience leading a team
Experience with formal controls and working with auditors is preferred

Skills and Abilities

Highly motivated, self-starter & team player with a high energy level and willingness to take on responsibility
Strong working knowledge of actuarial modeling systems; AXIS experience preferred
Excellent team-building skills, with the ability to recruit, retain, coach, delegate and mentor top-quality staff
Highly organized and disciplined enforcer of model governance protocols
Strong understanding of actuarial projections and interactions between various product features and actuarial calculation results
Ability to work and effectively communicate with employees at all levels and from various areas within the Company
Open and direct communicator who provides clear direction with a results-oriented style
Unconditional integrity and commitment to delivering accurate information on schedule with committed dates of delivery
Ability to fully assess deliverable requirements against allocated resources setting priorities and calling on additional resources as required
Ability to participate in establishing goals, structures, and processes necessary to implement a mission and strategic vision
Strong problem-solving skills that include advanced analytical and reasoning abilities, and ability to juggle multiple priorities simultaneously
Support effective partnerships with key groups and individuals while possessing superior consultation and change management skills
